history.text: I think jaws is a great movie - a classic! Have you seen it?
One of Spielberg's best movie
It is a sensationally effective picture
Rotten tomatoes gave it a score of 97%. What rating would you give it?
I couldn't do any better than the 97% rating
What did you make of Roy Scheinder?
I don't know him from anything else, but I loved his character.  He's a crazy mofo, but I would def be friends with him in real life.
Wasn't the movie based loosely on real events?
I know it's base on a novel of the same name by Peter Benchley

And it is set in a fictional New England summer resort town, so don't
 it is base on real events
Yep! I fund it hilarious that one critic described jaws as too gruesome for children and stomach turning for the impressionable any age.
hahaha

and the part about you feeling like a rat, being given sho
ck therapy
Spielberg is blessed with a talent that is clearly absent from most American filmmakers these days.
His onscreen story telling is unlike none
I guess the graphics and gore were state of the art in 1975. But, yes, he is great at story-telling and developing characters.
I wonder if the book received any acclaim prior to the movie.
With the movie having an average rating of 9.2/10, then the book should have received some high praises

I find it so interesting how in the movie when the town tried to cover up the shark attack and then the citizens went on a shark hunting frenzy - all those actions are spot on to how people have reacted in real life. Yet, the shark's behavior was pretty wrong.
For $10,000 I too would offer my service just as Quint did
What did you think of hoopers's character?
I could tell he was a good oceanographer and he cared he scared for the safety of the town
You could tell Vaughn interest was just on the revenue the beach could generate during the holidays
How did you feel about Brody's son going into shock?
Once brody's son goes into shock. it started hitting closer to home for brody, Vaughan, and the town officials. They only began to care and realize the severity when it affected them personally.
Hooper cared more about the townspeople, and he had the least connection to them.
that was the sad part about it
What do you think of the quint and hooper team on the orca?
I feel bad for Quint
He was doing it solely for the money
but unfortunately for me, had to be devoured by the shark
So who gets the 10,000 now?
Hooper was courageous though, entering the water with a scuba gear, even with the shark-proof cage
Lol. I guess nobody gets it now
Have you seen any of the sequels to jaws?
It was smart thinking of Brody stuffing that pressurized scuba tank in the shark's mouth
Jaws has sequels?

I didn't
 know that
Yes, at least Brody redeemed himself with his bravery.
It comes with the job
Yes a few sequels, but Spielberg didn't direct, and they were incredibly b-rated. Probably straight to tape/dvd.
Good thing then I did not see any
